> My ve=
rsion of Eclipse is 1.2.2 for PHP Devs (my primary lang) containing Eclipse=
 3.5.2.
>

> C:\Program Files\eclipse\plugins\org.junit_3.8.2.v20090203-1005
>

I also downloaded and placed junit-4.8.1.jar in that same dir.

Hi, Nuttzy.=
 First of all, I don't think just placing junit-4.8.1.jar
under eclipse\plu=
gins will work.=C2=A0Though I'm not entirely familiar with
how Eclipse plug=
in loading works, I would advise against it because
Eclipse might get confu=
sed and you'll start running into classpath
issues.

I think you need to go=
 to "Help" -> "Install New Software..." then
pick the Galileo software site=
 (I'm just guessing where the plugin is
located, YMMV) and look for somethi=
ng like "JUnit Testing Framework
Version 4".

Hope I managed to point you i=
n the general direction.

- alistair
